byline.contributor: Julie Bosman reported from Chicago, and Motoko Rich from New York.
byline.original: By JULIE BOSMAN and MOTOKO RICH

abstract: Schools across United States are grappling with differing policies regarding rights of transgender students and their access to school bathrooms and lockers rooms.
lead_paragraph: Many schools have crafted policies that require transgender students to use private changing and showering facilities, drawing complaints of discrimination.

headline.main: As Transgender Students Make Gains, Schools Hesitate at Bathrooms
headline.print_headline: As Transgender Students Make Gains, Schools Hesitate Over Bathroom Policies

snippet: Many schools have crafted policies that require transgender students to use private changing and showering facilities, drawing complaints of discrimination.
